name: protracting
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
protract
to make something last for a long time or last longer than necessary: I have no desire to protract the process. Their guest did not protract his stay an hour longer. See
protracted
More examplesFewer examples It was in no one's interest to protract the situation any further.Protracting the issue could lead to unnecessary publicity.They tried to protract the discussion.
